{{about|the U.S. season|the UK season|The Apprentice (UK series four)}} {{Infobox Television The Apprentice | season_name = The Apprentice 4 | image = | caption = | first_aired = September 22, [[2005]] | last_aired = December 15, [[2005]] | filming_started = April 2005 | filming_completed = May 2005 | winner = [[Randal Pinkett]] | number_candidates= 18 | number_episodes = 13 | previous_season = ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. season 3)|The Apprentice 3]]'' | next_season = ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. season 5)|The Apprentice 5]]'' | teams = Excel and Capital Edge }} '''''The Apprentice 4''''' is the fourth season of '''''[[The Apprentice (U.S. TV series)|The Apprentice]]''''', with [[Donald Trump]] as the executive producer and host. The show was aired on Thursday nights at 9 p.m. on [[NBC]] and started September 22, 2005. This was the first season of the show not to place in the Top 20 Nielsen Ratings; it averaged #38 with 11.01 million viewers. ==Candidates== Unhappy with ''both'' the choice of candidates and the "street smarts" vs. "book smarts" premise from the preceding season, Trump went to the auditions and hand-picked 17 of the 18 candidates on Season 4.{{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= | title=Trump Redevelops His Own Series |date= | publisher= | url =http://tools.wikimedia.de/~magnus/makeref.php | work = | pages = | accessdate = 2006-07-26 | language = }} In addition to candidate handpicking, Trump decided to go back to the premise of men versus women (there was eventually corporate restructuring). The all-women team named their corporation '''Capital Edge''' while the all-men team named their corporation '''Excel'''. The winning project manager, throughout the season, may be exempt from firing for the following week if the majority of the other members in their team believed he/she did a satisfactory job. When Trump asked if Markus (the winning project manager) should be exempt, only Adam and Randal voted yes, which was not a majority vote and did not grant Markus immunity from the next firing. **'''Excel's reward:''' [[New York Friars' Club|Friar's Club]] lunch with [[Donald Trump]]. *'''Losing team:''' Capital Edge **'''Team's profit:''' $516 **'''Reasons for loss:''' Even though they had lost by only $11, Kristi's idea for the marketing flyer was awful. The flyer that came out from the graphic designer had read "Triple XXX Threat", and alluded to [[pornography]]. **'''Initial boardroom:''' A majority of Capital Edge said that Melissa was very negative, dramatic, and obnoxious.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week1_5boardroom.html |title=Episode 1 - Boardroom |accessdate=2006-07-27 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} Melissa acknowledged that she let Kristi get under her skin, but she reminded Trump that her insubordination was not why they lost the task, and that Kristi was mainly responsible, due to her shoddy leadership and that blatant-made marketing flyer. **'''Sent to boardroom:''' Kristi and Melissa **'''Fired:''' Melissa - for being an incredibly disruptive force, not getting along with the team, and for not being able to work with women. *'''Notes:''' ** After splitting the candidates into the two teams, Trump offered a reward to the first person to reach his helicopter, which was on the other side of the golf course. The winner's team would be granted the use of the helicopter for the duration of the task. Mark, from Excel, reached the helicopter first.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week1_2assignment.html |title=Episode 1 - Assignment |accessdate=2006-07-27 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} **When the team voted not to grant Markus immunity for the following week, Josh said that the men did not intend to grant any winning project manager immunity during the course of the season, as they felt that no candidate could single-handedly be responsible for a team's victory. Ultimately however, every other victorious project manager this season (apart from Clay in Week 8) would be voted to receive immunity by their team-mates. **Kristi asks if she could bring only one person back into the boardroom. Trump complied, making it the first time in ''Apprentice'' history that only one candidate was brought back, when they had the option to bring back two. This would not be the only time, as future candidates would also only bring back one person to the boardroom in this season. **Melissa's firing marked the first time that a female competitor was the first person to be fired from the show. All previous seasons featured a man being the first one fired. **Kristi made a smug [[smirk]] after Trump fired Melissa, and Trump immediately chastised her for it, saying she had "nothing to be proud of". **Melissa virtually destroyed her chances of being hired by Trump and continuing on the show when she admitted (repeatedly) that she can not get along with women. She also added that women generally dislike her because they feel threatened or intimidated by her beauty and intelligence, which did not impress Trump or his advisors. **Melissa later appeared on a [[Dr. Phil]] episode where she continued to blame Kristi for her firing (though she didn't refer to Kristi by name) before conceding that she hadn't done a good job and needed to look more closely at herself for that. **During the filming of the first task, Randal was told that his grandmother had died. After announcing Excel's win, Trump gave Randal the opportunity to leave the show. Randal declined, saying he felt that his grandmother would have wanted him to stay on the show.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week1_4results.html |title=Episode 1 - Results |accessdate=2006-07-27 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} During the filming of episode 2, Trump allowed Randal to borrow his helicopter and attend the funeral. *[http://www.nbc.com/The_Apprentice_4/recaps/week1_p1.shtml Episode 1 Recap from NBC.com] ===Week 2: There's No Little "i" in Team=== *'''Air date:''' September 29, 2005 *'''Sponsor:''' [[Lamborghini]] *'''Project:''' Teams had to create an advertising campaign for Lamborghini cars. *'''Capital Edge project manager:''' Marshawn *'''Excel project manager:''' Chris *'''Winning team:''' Capital Edge **'''Reasons for victory:''' Their campaign was very strong overall and had no significant weaknesses, and the Lamborghini executives particularly liked the fact that their campaign conveyed the message through images and emotion alone, without needing too much text. They also liked their advertisement, presentation, and the video. **'''Exemption:''' All of Capital Edge (with the exception of Kristi) voted to have Marshawn exempt from firing in Week 3. **'''Capital Edge's reward:''' Hockey with [[New York Islanders]] legends and prospects. *** At the reward, Rebecca fell and broke her ankle. *'''Losing team:''' Excel **'''Reasons for loss''': Both teams' videos were phenomenal,{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} but there was a difference about presentations and the ad posters. And it falls down with Excel. Lamborghini judges felt Excel's presentation was too wordy. They were not sure about their concepts, they felt it was out of key. And frankly, grammatical errors spotted on the team's printed ad posters; one ad read "Green With Envy" whilst Markus tried to inform his team it should have read "Green With Envy?". And the second ad, the executives didn't like the fact that the Italian on "Rebrith of Italian Intimidation" had a lowercase "i" on their ad.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week2_5boardroom.html |title=Episode 2 - Boardroom |accessdate=2006-07-29 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} **'''Sent to boardroom:''' Chris and Markus ***'''Firing verdict:''' Prior to Chris choosing only Markus back to the boardroom, Trump made it clear that Chris should bring Mark into the boardroom, because Mark was responsible for the bad grammar on the ads. Chris took the blame for Mark's mistake, saying he believed in Mark and when Mark failed, he failed too.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/The_Apprentice_4/recaps/week2_p18.shtml |title=Week 2 |accessdate=2006-07-29 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} **'''Fired:''' Chris - for his poor leadership quality, producing a mediocre ad-poster especially presentation, and allowing his emotions to influence his decision-making after bringing in Markus back to the boardroom and for essentially being responsible for the loss after not bringing in Mark instead. *'''Notes:''' **Chris was adamant about getting Markus fired (because he disrupted the team's unity) and even though several other members of Excel wanted Markus gone as well, Trump and his advisors reminded them that Markus was not responsible for losing the task, and he even had the correct idea for one of their ads. **Trump and his advisors saw potential in Chris, but they did not like the fact that he deliberately brought back Markus and not Mark, after Trump clearly stated not to do so otherwise. Chris had also brought back Markus alone, which did not statistically improve his chances of not being fired. **In his exit interview, Chris continued to bad-mouth Markus. **In the middle of the task, Randal left to attend his grandmotherâs funeral. He arrived back at the agency as Excel was getting ready to present their advertising campaign to Lamborghini.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/The_Apprentice_4/recaps/week2_p9.shtml |title=Week 2 |accessdate=2006-07-29 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} **The little "i" in the episodeâs title refers to the error in Excelâs advertising. Mark thought that using the small "i" in "Rebirth of Italian Intimidation" to match the small "i's" in Lamborghini would have looked better.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week2_3task.html |title=Episode 2 - Task Report |accessdate=2006-07-29 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} **Because of the NHL lockout taking place during filming of this task, the reward only involved Islanders legends and prospects. Active players were not eligible to participate in the reward because of the lockout not having been settled at the time of taping. *[http://www.nbc.com/The_Apprentice_4/recaps/week2_p1.shtml Episode 2 Recap from NBC.com] ===Week 3: Something Old, Something New=== *'''Air date:''' October 6, 2005 *'''Sponsor:''' [[Best Buy]] [[Geek Squad]] *'''Project:''' Excel and Capital Edge were both given space at the Cedar Crest Village Home in [[Pompton Plains, New Jersey]] to host a technology expo for the senior citizens. All the equipment was purchased at Best Buy using the allotted Best Buy gift cards.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week3_2assignment.html |title=Week 3 - Assignment |accessdate=2006-08-08 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} *'''Capital Edge project manager:''' Rebecca *'''Excel project manager:''' Randal *'''Winning team:''' Excel **'''Reason for victory:''' The men created a lot of buzz around their expo, and focused on demonstrations that would be easy to follow and would allow the senior citizens to interact with the new technology. **'''Exemption:''' Excel voted unanimously to have Randal exempt from firing for Week 4.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/The_Apprentice_4/recaps/week3_p14.shtml |title=Week 3 Episode Recap |accessdate=2006-08-08 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} **'''Excel's reward:''' Handing out toys to children at a hospital. *'''Losing team:''' Capital Edge **'''Reasons for loss:''' Although the technology demonstrations were generally okay (with the notable exception of Toral, who got completely lost while trying to demonstrate a TV), the team was let down badly by Jennifer W's poor organisation and decoration of the event, which looked bare and uninviting. Particular attention was drawn to the fact that some of the promotional material read "Tethno Expo" instead of "Techno Expo," but was still used anyway. **'''Sent to boardroom:''' Rebecca, Jennifer M., and Jennifer W., in spite of the team's criticisms and a strong suggestion by Trump for Toral to be brought back.{{cite web|url=http://apprentice.tv.yahoo.com/trump/04/show/summary/week3_5boardroom.html |title=Week 3 - Boardroom |accessdate=2006-08-08 |last= |first= |coauthors= |date= |work= |publisher= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} ***'''Boardroom Verdict:''' Trump disagreed with Rebeccaâs decision to not bring Toral back, as well as her decision to bring in Jennifer M. for the boardroom; however, he felt that Rebecca had potential. At Randal's recommendation, Trump rescinded what could have been the first multiple-hiring and a US Apprentice first.{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/10485160/page/2/ |title= 'Apprentice' winner refuses to share title|publisher= [[MSNBC]]|date=2005-12-22|accessdate=2008-03-01}} Throughout the following week, many were critical of Randal's decision.
